articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Crispian Balmer, Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The U.N. Security Council is also set to vote on a demand for a ceasefire between Israel and Palestinian militants Hamas and humanitarian access across Gaza.
articles.title: US signals veto of UN Security Council demand for Gaza ceasefire

articles.author: Julia Payne, Leigh Thomas
articles.description: Trade talks between the European Union and the United States are going in the right direction, Europe's top trade negotiator said, while criticising a doubling of U.S. metals tariffs as a move that did not help with the negotiations.
articles.title: Doubled US tariffs on steel, aluminium kick in as deadline for 'best offers' hits

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday openly questioned the point of peace talks with Ukraine after accusing Kyiv's senior leadership of ordering deadly terrorist attacks on bridges in Russia that killed seven and injured 115 more.
articles.title: Putin openly questions peace talks after blaming Ukraine for deadly bridge attack in Russia

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: The Venezuelans were deported in March after Trump invoked the 1798 Alien Enemies Act to swiftly deport alleged members of the Tren de Aragua gang without going through normal immigration procedures.
articles.title: Hundreds of Venezuelans deported to El Salvador have right to challenge detention, judge rules

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi, Elwely Elwelly, Jana Choukeir
articles.description: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said that abandoning uranium enrichment was "100%" against the country's interests, rejecting a central U.S. demand in talks to resolve a decades-long dispute over Tehran's nuclear ambitions.
articles.title: Iran's Khamenei dismisses US nuclear proposal, vows to keep enriching uranium

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Idrees Ali
articles.description: The two U.S. officials, who spoke on the condition of anonymity, estimated the Ukrainian strikes destroyed around 10 and hit up to 20 warplanes in total.
articles.title: Exclusive: Ukraine hit fewer Russian planes than it estimated, US officials say

articles.author: Anna Mehler Paperny
articles.description: A Canadian border-security bill introduced by the Liberal government earlier this week may deny some asylum-seekers a refugee hearing and make it easier for the government to revoke migrants' status.
articles.title: Canadian bill seeks to deny hearings to some asylum-seekers

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un met Russia's Secretary of the Security Council Sergei Shoigu on Wednesday, state media KCNA reported.
articles.title: North Korea's Kim vows unconditional support for Russia in meeting with Shoigu

articles.author: Dave Sherwood, Mario Fuentes
articles.description: Cuban students clamored on Wednesday for further concessions to roll back a rate hike on internet data, saying a decision on Monday to offer them discounted access did not go far enough.
articles.title: Cuban students seek concessions as frustration grows over internet rate hikes

articles.author: Joyce Lee, Ju-Min Park
articles.description: South Korea woke on Wednesday to a new liberal president, Lee Jae-myung, who vowed to raise the country from the turmoil of a martial law crisis and revive an economy reeling from slowing growth and the threat of global protectionism.
articles.title: South Korea's liberal new president Lee Jae-myung vows economic revival, judgement against martial law
